section: 1. TERM OF CONTRACT The Term of this Agreement shall be for a period of [* ****] years and [*****] months commencing the 1st day of September 2004 and terminating the [*****] day of [*****].
explanation: The Term of Contract duration is not properly defined as the end date is not complete, which creates an ambiguity.

section: Notwithstanding any other paragraph of this Agreement, in the event that CONSULTANT dies or is unable to play tour golf at all, ADAMS GOLF may terminate this Agreement on thirty (30) days' written notice. Upon such termination, CONSULTANT and/or CONSULTANT'S estate shall be required to repay ADAMS GOLF for that period of the Agreement not performed by CONSULTANT. The repayment amount shall be calculated in the same way as repayment is calculated under paragraph 8A.
explanation: It is illogical to require CONSULTANT'S estate to repay ADAMS GOLF if CONSULTANT dies.

section: ADAMS GOLF must exercise its right of termination within ninety (90) days of its senior management becoming aware of the conduct giving rise to the right of termination.
explanation: The phrase 'senior management becoming aware of the conduct' is ambiguous. It's unclear which specific individuals or roles constitute 'senior management,' leading to potential disputes over when the 90-day period begins.
